instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message:
hello
820-3787-a stuck at halfway loading bar

no liquid damage
can't find damage under the microscope..

when i try recovery mode also doesn't load to the recovery,
but stuck with the apple logo and halfway loading bar...

also without the ssd...

seems like doesn't detect the ssd, but could be because the board efi has not been updated to support high sierra yet..

any ideas?

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message: Run ASD EFI version first. Was is already messed with? Especially GPU area.

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message:
hi

on the build in diagnostic it reports no issues...

doesnt seem like it was messed with...
it has something looks like red glue supporting the gpu corners, but could be the original...

sorry for the question...
but where can i get ASD EFI image for this model?

thanks..

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message: Check this file and search through Internet for correct model of your machine...

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message: Picture pease? Apple never used red edge bonding for the GPUs.

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message: Yeah if there is red edge bonding, someone has replaced the GPU. I've had a few like that I refuse to mess with them

threads.title: 820-3787-A stuck at halfway loading bar
threads.message:
seems like it's been messed with..
i've passed on this one, giving it back to the owner...
this thread can be closed...

btw john, duke - can you please give your opinion on the 820-4924 no keyboard \ trackpad..?

[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/38274-820-4924-no-keyboard/page2[/url]

thanks alot...!
